title: Worked Solution
text:
To calculate the wavelength corresponding to the energy of the photon emitted, we can use the relationship between energy and wavelength:

E $$=$$ $$ rac{hc}{\lambda}$$

Where:
- E is the energy of the photon $$(2.84$$ $$	imes$$ 10**{-19} $$\$$, $$	ext{J})$$
- $$h$$ is Planck's constant $$(6.626$$ $$	imes$$ 10**{-34} $$\$$, $$	ext{J}\cdot	ext{s})$$
- c is the speed of light $$(3.00$$ $$	imes$$ $${10}^8$$ $$\$$, 	ext{m/s})$$
- $$\lambda$$ is the wavelength in meters (which we will calculate)

First, solve for $$\lambda$$: $$
$$ $$
$$ $$\lambda$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{hc}{E}$$

Substitute the given values into the equation:

$$\lambda$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{(6.626$$ $$	imes$$ 10**{-34} $$\$$, $$	ext{J}\cdot	ext{s})$$ $$	imes$$ $$(3.00$$ $$	imes$$ $${10}^8$$ $$\$$, 	ext{m/s})}{2.84 $$	imes$$ 10**{-19} $$\$$, $$	ext{J}}$$

Now, calculate the wavelength. I'll compute that for you.

The calculated wavelength of the photon is approximately $$699.93$$ nm, rounded to two decimal places.
